# The `APFloat.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file declares a class to represent arbitrary precision floating point values and provide a variety of arithmetic operations on them. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A self-contained host- and target-independent arbitrary-precision</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// floating-point software implementation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// APFloat uses bignum integer arithmetic as provided by static functions in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the APInt class.  The library will work with bignum integers whose parts are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// any unsigned type at least 16 bits wide, but 64 bits is recommended.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Written for clarity rather than speed, in particular with a view to use in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the front-end of a cross compiler so that target arithmetic can be correctly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// performed on the host.  Performance should nonetheless be reasonable,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// particularly for its intended use.  It may be useful as a base</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// implementation for a run-time library during development of a faster</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// target-specific one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All 5 rounding modes in the IEEE-754R draft are handled correctly for all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// implemented operations.  Currently implemented operations are add, subtract,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// multiply, divide, fused-multiply-add, conversion-to-float,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// conversion-to-integer and conversion-from-integer.  New rounding modes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (e.g. away from zero) can be added with three or four lines of code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Four formats are built-in: IEEE single precision, double precision,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// quadruple precision, and x87 80-bit extended double (when operating with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// full extended precision).  Adding a new format that obeys IEEE semantics</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only requires adding two lines of code: a declaration and definition of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// format.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All operations return the status of that operation as an exception bit-mask,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// so multiple operations can be done consecutively with their results or-ed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// together.  The returned status can be useful for compiler diagnostics; e.g.,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inexact, underflow and overflow can be easily diagnosed on constant folding,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and compiler optimizers can determine what exceptions would be raised by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// folding operations and optimize, or perhaps not optimize, accordingly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// At present, underflow tininess is detected after rounding; it should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// straight forward to add support for the before-rounding case too.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The library reads hexadecimal floating point numbers as per C99, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// correctly rounds if necessary according to the specified rounding mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Syntax is required to have been validated by the caller.  It also converts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// floating point numbers to hexadecimal text as per the C99 %a and %A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// conversions.  The output precision (or alternatively the natural minimal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// precision) can be specified; if the requested precision is less than the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// natural precision the output is correctly rounded for the specified rounding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It also reads decimal floating point numbers and correctly rounds according</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to the specified rounding mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Conversion to decimal text is not currently implemented.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Non-zero finite numbers are represented internally as a sign bit, a 16-bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// signed exponent, and the significand as an array of integer parts.  After</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// normalization of a number of precision P the exponent is within the range of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the format, and if the number is not denormal the P-th bit of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// significand is set as an explicit integer bit.  For denormals the most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// significant bit is shifted right so that the exponent is maintained at the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// format&#39;s minimum, so that the smallest denormal has just the least</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// significant bit of the significand set.  The sign of zeroes and infinities</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is significant; the exponent and significand of such numbers is not stored,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// but has a known implicit (deterministic) value: 0 for the significands, 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for zero exponent, all 1 bits for infinity exponent.  For NaNs the sign and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// significand are deterministic, although not really meaningful, and preserved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in non-conversion operations.  The exponent is implicitly all 1 bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// APFloat does not provide any exception handling beyond default exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// handling. We represent Signaling NaNs via IEEE-754R 2008 6.2.1 should clause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by encoding Signaling NaNs with the first bit of its trailing significand as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ====</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Some features that may or may not be worth adding:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Binary to decimal conversion (hard).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Optional ability to detect underflow tininess before rounding.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// New formats: x87 in single and double precision mode (IEEE apart from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// extended exponent range) (hard).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// New operations: sqrt, IEEE remainder, C90 fmod, nexttoward.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the common type definitions shared by APFloat and its internal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implementation classes. This struct should not define any non-static data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// members.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase">APFloatBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a86aa96e22d365ebc7653372bed96a778"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a5221357e5b7511cb0c90c94044ba35cf">APInt::WordType</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a86aa96e22d365ebc7653372bed96a778">integerPart</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a81cd273998d8aef3f44da0550bc3ab4b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a81cd273998d8aef3f44da0550bc3ab4b">integerPartWidth</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d">APInt::APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A signed type to represent a floating point numbers unbiased exponent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#afe80c9bd1684d47025d691a7eabcb656"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> int32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#afe80c9bd1684d47025d691a7eabcb656">ExponentType</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\name Floating Point Semantics.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52">Semantics</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a34e6dc98e540680ba8a019c81ea26459"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a34e6dc98e540680ba8a019c81ea26459">S&#95;IEEEhalf</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a4ac2c7646ad25f6198c3cbbc627c5b54"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a4ac2c7646ad25f6198c3cbbc627c5b54">S&#95;BFloat</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a256aae058a9193e7a33e5c1e74487863"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a256aae058a9193e7a33e5c1e74487863">S&#95;IEEEsingle</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52addf4aea26776fa9ef6fbecdd9d4bd42f"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52addf4aea26776fa9ef6fbecdd9d4bd42f">S&#95;IEEEdouble</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a905c1ddc4453cfcbc4365f95ca89a188"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a905c1ddc4453cfcbc4365f95ca89a188">S&#95;IEEEquad</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The IBM double-double semantics. Such a number consists of a pair of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// IEEE 64-bit doubles (Hi, Lo), where |Hi| &gt; |Lo|, and if normal,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (double)(Hi + Lo) == Hi. The numeric value it&#39;s modeling is Hi + Lo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Therefore it has two 53-bit mantissa parts that aren&#39;t necessarily</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adjacent to each other, and two 11-bit exponents.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: we need to make the value different from semBogus as otherwise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// an unsafe optimization may collapse both values to a single address,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and we heavily rely on them having distinct addresses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a601f9d15fb988710f86c2481f0982cff"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a601f9d15fb988710f86c2481f0982cff">S&#95;PPCDoubleDouble</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These are legacy semantics for the fallback, inaccurate implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of IBM double-double, if the accurate semPPCDoubleDouble doesn&#39;t handle</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the operation. It&#39;s equivalent to having an IEEE number with consecutive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 106 bits of mantissa and 11 bits of exponent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It&#39;s not equivalent to IBM double-double. For example, a legit IBM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// double-double, 1 + epsilon:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 + epsilon = 1 + (1 &gt;&gt; 1076)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is not representable by a consecutive 106 bits of mantissa.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Currently, these semantics are used in the following way:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   semPPCDoubleDouble -&gt; (IEEEdouble, IEEEdouble) -&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (64-bit APInt, 64-bit APInt) -&gt; (128-bit APInt) -&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   semPPCDoubleDoubleLegacy -&gt; IEEE operations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We use bitcastToAPInt() to get the bit representation (in APInt) of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// underlying IEEEdouble, then use the APInt constructor to construct the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// legacy IEEE float.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Implement all operations in semPPCDoubleDouble, and delete these</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// semantics.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ae1a763752ce9783b8ed283af10e5dccb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ae1a763752ce9783b8ed283af10e5dccb">S&#95;PPCDoubleDoubleLegacy</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number following IEEE-754 conventions with bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// layout S1E5M2 as described in https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.05433.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a5360fa26ec11b4638e0ac1b1b4dbb30b"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a5360fa26ec11b4638e0ac1b1b4dbb30b">S&#95;Float8E5M2</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number mostly following IEEE-754 conventions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and bit layout S1E5M2 described in https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.02915,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with expanded range and with no infinity or signed zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaN is represented as negative zero. (FN -&gt; Finite, UZ -&gt; unsigned zero).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This format&#39;s exponent bias is 16, instead of the 15 (2 &#42;&#42; (5 - 1) - 1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that IEEE precedent would imply.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac6275c0290c28bf6d94af2651f0af108"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac6275c0290c28bf6d94af2651f0af108">S&#95;Float8E5M2FNUZ</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number following IEEE-754 conventions with bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// layout S1E4M3.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a6b22aebe60dd7c23142230f419cf4587"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a6b22aebe60dd7c23142230f419cf4587">S&#95;Float8E4M3</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number mostly following IEEE-754 conventions with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bit layout S1E4M3 as described in https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.05433.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unlike IEEE-754 types, there are no infinity values, and NaN is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// represented with the exponent and mantissa bits set to all 1s.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52aa5355a964dc9ce6a38b183340262cc4b"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52aa5355a964dc9ce6a38b183340262cc4b">S&#95;Float8E4M3FN</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number mostly following IEEE-754 conventions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and bit layout S1E4M3 described in https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.02915,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with expanded range and with no infinity or signed zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaN is represented as negative zero. (FN -&gt; Finite, UZ -&gt; unsigned zero).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This format&#39;s exponent bias is 8, instead of the 7 (2 &#42;&#42; (4 - 1) - 1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that IEEE precedent would imply.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a3397bd1915e0cb2c7cb7b5e09c1d556c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a3397bd1915e0cb2c7cb7b5e09c1d556c">S&#95;Float8E4M3FNUZ</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number mostly following IEEE-754 conventions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and bit layout S1E4M3 with expanded range and with no infinity or signed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaN is represented as negative zero. (FN -&gt; Finite, UZ -&gt; unsigned zero).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This format&#39;s exponent bias is 11, instead of the 7 (2 &#42;&#42; (4 - 1) - 1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that IEEE precedent would imply.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac66c5550fab7a97aa213b82f4ead8882"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac66c5550fab7a97aa213b82f4ead8882">S&#95;Float8E4M3B11FNUZ</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number following IEEE-754 conventions with bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// layout S1E3M4.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52acc6b5146d622a16b408c9fffbde9b934"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52acc6b5146d622a16b408c9fffbde9b934">S&#95;Float8E3M4</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Floating point number that occupies 32 bits or less of storage, providing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// improved range compared to half (16-bit) formats, at (potentially)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// greater throughput than single precision (32-bit) formats.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ab04e922575a47a53d1a406925985d5f2"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ab04e922575a47a53d1a406925985d5f2">S&#95;FloatTF32</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 8-bit floating point number with (all the) 8 bits for the exponent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// like in FP32. There are no zeroes, no infinities, and no denormal values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This format has unsigned representation only. (U -&gt; Unsigned only).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaN is represented with all bits set to 1 Bias is 127</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This format represents the scale data type in the MX specification from:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://www.opencompute.org/documents/ocp-microscaling-formats-mx-v1-0-spec-final-pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52af9c857c44bca65044d0582c1aa608f01"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52af9c857c44bca65044d0582c1aa608f01">S&#95;Float8E8M0FNU</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 6-bit floating point number with bit layout S1E3M2. Unlike IEEE-754</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// types, there are no infinity or NaN values. The format is detailed in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://www.opencompute.org/documents/ocp-microscaling-formats-mx-v1-0-spec-final-pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a99773cadb5a3e21af5ad411ff0d56bcf"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a99773cadb5a3e21af5ad411ff0d56bcf">S&#95;Float6E3M2FN</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 6-bit floating point number with bit layout S1E2M3. Unlike IEEE-754</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// types, there are no infinity or NaN values. The format is detailed in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://www.opencompute.org/documents/ocp-microscaling-formats-mx-v1-0-spec-final-pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a17d727cd884fae7f7f3f1b3e029ac575"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a17d727cd884fae7f7f3f1b3e029ac575">S&#95;Float6E2M3FN</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 4-bit floating point number with bit layout S1E2M1. Unlike IEEE-754</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// types, there are no infinity or NaN values. The format is detailed in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://www.opencompute.org/documents/ocp-microscaling-formats-mx-v1-0-spec-final-pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a8dd16c9eabbd4b03bad890b2bba3868c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a8dd16c9eabbd4b03bad890b2bba3868c">S&#95;Float4E2M1FN</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Documentation is missing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac2304127435c8b9489c15b90cc9b1239"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac2304127435c8b9489c15b90cc9b1239">S&#95;x87DoubleExtended</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a0a10ccbbf040ec937bbfc491920e2e7d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52a0a10ccbbf040ec937bbfc491920e2e7d">S&#95;MaxSemantics</a> = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#ae28d826c1042631ac188d8295949ff52ac2304127435c8b9489c15b90cc9b1239">S&#95;x87DoubleExtended</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns true if any number described by this semantics can be precisely</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// represented by the specified semantics. Does not take into account</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the value of fltNonfiniteBehavior, hasZero, hasSignedRepr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlight">  static </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#abcbf7e10dae54479fd98a43302c14037">isRepresentableBy</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// IEEE-754R isSignMinus: Returns true if and only if the current value is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// negative.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Overload to compute a hash code for an APFloat value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that the use of hash codes for floating point values is in general</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// frought with peril. Equality is hard to define for these values. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// example, should negative and positive zero hash to different codes? Are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// they equal or not? This hash value implementation specifically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// emphasizes producing different codes for different inputs in order to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// be used in canonicalization and memoization. As such, equality is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// bitwiseIsEqual, and 0 != 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a87ec5cfce4a8b6896193c822f2dc5894">hash&#95;value</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat">IEEEFloat</a> &amp;Arg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Converts this value into a decimal string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param FormatPrecision The maximum number of digits of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   precision to output.  If there are fewer digits available,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   zero padding will not be used unless the value is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   integral and small enough to be expressed in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   FormatPrecision digits.  0 means to use the natural</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   precision of the number.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param FormatMaxPadding The maximum number of zeros to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   consider inserting before falling back to scientific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   notation.  0 means to always use scientific notation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param TruncateZero Indicate whether to remove the trailing zero in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   fraction part or not. Also setting this parameter to false forcing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   producing of output more similar to default printf behavior.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Specifically the lower e is used as exponent delimiter and exponent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   always contains no less than two digits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Number       Precision    MaxPadding      Result</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ------       ---------    ----------      ------</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 10100              5             2       10100</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 10100              4             2       10100</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 10100              5             1       10100</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0.0101              5             2       0.0101</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0.0101              4             2       0.0101</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0.0101              4             1       0.0101</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a462d954821ce6386847608cf825ed480">toString</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;Str, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FormatPrecision = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlight">                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FormatMaxPadding = 3, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TruncateZero = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If this value has an exact multiplicative inverse, store it in inv and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// return true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a21d5827d6fe2592fea86c1f7bf386fe9">getExactInverse</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &#42;inv) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is an exact power of two, return the exponent while ignoring the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sign bit. If it&#39;s not an exact power of 2, return INT&#95;MIN</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ab8e0eab61769d9974aeed9345ce11baf">LLVM&#95;READONLY</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a250ae807ddec8d1d8881d01a7d24dc44">getExactLog2Abs</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is an exact power of two, return the exponent. If it&#39;s not an exact</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// power of 2, return INT&#95;MIN</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ab8e0eab61769d9974aeed9345ce11baf">LLVM&#95;READONLY</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#ae85740a44b2f435c6844cf491be1e20e"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#ae85740a44b2f435c6844cf491be1e20e">getExactLog2</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a35a8501e30440512c90175d5c9da1e21">isNegative</a>() ? <Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A binary fraction with an explicit integer bit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The significand must be at least one bit wider than the target precision.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">union </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Significand &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#afa56d865e527ea20a3023a93a825fe6d">integerPart</a> part;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The signed unbiased exponent of the value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a6516d416a36a2fb0ad78c9d099ccadaf">ExponentType</a> exponent;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// What kind of floating point number this is.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Only 2 bits are required, but VisualStudio incorrectly sign extends it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Using the extra bit keeps it from failing under VisualStudio.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlight">  fltCategory category : 3;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sign bit of the number.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This mode implements more precise float in terms of two APFloats.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The interface and layout is designed for arbitrary underlying semantics,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// though currently only PPCDoubleDouble semantics are supported, whose</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// corresponding underlying semantics are IEEEdouble.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/doubleapfloat"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/doubleapfloat/#ab289b202c32cf7b49760915cec8f299a">DoubleAPFloat</a> final &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Negate an APFloat.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1262" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat/#a98d55d6fc5c66837024b06bfc115ed4c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  APFloat <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat/#a98d55d6fc5c66837024b06bfc115ed4c">operator-</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We don&#39;t rely on operator== working on double values, as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it returns true for things that are clearly not equal, like 0 and 0.0.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1423"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// As such, this method can be used to do an exact bit-for-bit comparison of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// two floating point values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We leave the version with the double argument here because it&#39;s just so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// convenient to write &quot;2.0&quot; and the like.  Without this function we&#39;d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// have to duplicate its logic everywhere it&#39;s called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat/#a43efe9700a64d52fdf51d350923eef33"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat/#a43efe9700a64d52fdf51d350923eef33">isExactlyValue</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">double</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> V)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
